page.description: Alpha Anywhere provides extremely fine control over colors when you set the properties of object on layouts, or when you specify a color in an Xdialog form.

section.title: Specifying a Color
section.description: You can specify a color in two ways. If the color is a named color, you can do this.
If there is no named color available, you can specify the color's RGB values.

section.title: Specifying an Absolute Color
section.description: Given a color, you can set one or more of its values. The default color is "Black", which is "#0,0,0". The syntaxes are (remove all spaces in the final version):
section.example: ##Symbol Amount [ +Symbol Amount [ +Symbol Amount [ +Color_Name ]]] ##Symbol Amount [ +Symbol Amount [ +Symbol Amount [ +RGB_Value ]]]

section.description: For example, start with the color "Red" and set its blue component to 50 and green component to 25.
Starting with the default color "Black", define the color that we call "Blue" by setting its hue to 240, luminosity to 50, and saturation to 100.

section.title: Combining Relative and Absolute Syntaxes
section.description: This example takes "Light Blue" and decreases the hue by 25 and sets the luminosity to 75.
